page.title: 10EDUCATION
page.content: Until l974 our own primary school children (5_11yrs) attended our own little village school. But when the roll went down to 23 the school was closed down. Now seven children go to the schools in Rye, 3 miles to the east, and seven to Brede C.P. School, 3 miles to the west. Four children go to private schools. The secondary age children nearly all go to Thomas Peacocke Comprehensive School in Rye. Most leave at 16 after taking GCE 'O' level or CSE exams, but about a third stay on till 18 to take 'A' levels, or go to the Hastings College of Further Education for special vocational courses. A very few go on to Univer_ sity to take degrees. Four girls go to private boarding schools, coming home at weekends. There are at present 22 children in this age_group.
